title: Harrods' Qatari owners pocket £125m dividend despite dip in profits
text:
The Qatari owners of Harrods paid themselves a £125m dividend last year despite a dip in profits.

Harrods, which opened its Knightsbridge store in 1849, handed the payment to Qatar Holding, the investment arm of the country’s sovereign wealth fund.

The dividend, which is the same as in 2017, takes the total payouts handed to the Gulf-based group to £900m.

It came as Harrods reported a 3pc dip in profit to £171.6m for the year to February 9.

Harrods said the fall was partly due to a shorter accounting period than the previous year.

Qatar Holding bought Harrods in 2010 for £1.5bn from Egyptian businessman Mohamed Al-Fayed.

The group ploughed £64m of investment into Harrods during the year, with...
description: The Qatari owners of Harrods paid themselves a £125m dividend last year despite a dip in profits.
